# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_internal/resolution/resolvelib/base.py
@source-hash: 0c27faebd16cab24
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:57:47Z

## Purpose
Base types and abstractions for pip's resolvelib-based dependency resolver. Defines core interfaces and data structures for representing requirements, candidates, and constraints in the resolution process.

## Key Components

### `format_name()` (L15-19)
Utility function that formats project names with extras notation. Returns "project" or "project[extra1,extra2]" format for resolver display.

### `Constraint` (L22-58)
Immutable dataclass representing resolution constraints on packages:
- `specifier`: Version specifier requirements (L24)
- `hashes`: Required package hashes (L25) 
- `links`: Required source links (L26)

Key methods:
- `empty()` (L28-30): Creates empty constraint
- `from_ireq()` (L32-35): Constructs from InstallRequirement
- `__bool__()` (L37-38): True if any constraint field is non-empty
- `__and__()` (L40-48): Combines with InstallRequirement via intersection
- `is_satisfied_by()` (L50-57): Checks if candidate satisfies all constraints

### `Requirement` (L60-88)
Abstract base class for dependency requirements. Defines interface for:
- `project_name` (L61-69): Normalized project name without extras
- `name` (L71-78): Full requirement identifier with extras
- `is_satisfied_by()` (L80-81): Always returns False (subclass override)
- `get_candidate_lookup()` (L83-84): Returns candidate lookup tuple
- `format_for_error()` (L86-87): Error display formatting

### `Candidate` (L96-139)
Abstract base class for package candidates in resolution. Defines interface for:
- `project_name` (L97-105): Normalized project name without extras
- `name` (L107-114): Full candidate identifier with extras  
- `version` (L116-118): Package version
- `is_installed` (L120-122): Installation status
- `is_editable` (L124-126): Editable installation flag
- `source_link` (L128-130): Optional source URL
- `iter_dependencies()` (L132-133): Yields requirement dependencies
- `get_install_requirement()` (L135-136): Returns InstallRequirement if available
- `format_for_error()` (L138-139): Error display formatting

### `_match_link()` (L90-93)
Helper function checking if a link matches a candidate's source link using `links_equivalent()`.

## Dependencies
- `pip._vendor.packaging.*`: Version/specifier handling
- `pip._internal.models.link`: Link representation and comparison
- `pip._internal.req.req_install`: InstallRequirement integration
- `pip._internal.utils.hashes`: Hash constraint handling

## Type Definitions
- `CandidateLookup` (L12): Tuple of optional Candidate and InstallRequirement

## Architecture Notes
- Pure abstract base classes requiring subclass implementation
- Immutable constraint design with intersection operations
- Forward references to "Candidate" in type hints before class definition
- Trust model: Hash verification with `trust_internet=False` for security
